title: Son of AFL star sentenced to over six years jail for rape | ABC NEWS
description: Tom Silvagni, the son of former AFL player Stephen Silvagni, has been sentenced to six years and two months in jail after he was found guilty of rape. A suppression order was in place throughout the 23-year-old's trial to prevent the media from publishing his name or any details about his high-profile family. In his sentencing, Judge Greg Lyon praised the courage of the victim and said Silvagni failed to show remorse for his offending. title: Albanese’s 'wicked' antisemitism problem | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Catastrophe has a way of shaping leaders. Winston Churchill during World War Two, George Bush during 9/11 and Scott Morrison during the Black Summer bushfires.   It may define Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s leadership too, as he comes under pressure to respond to the antisemitism crisis and the Bondi Beach terror attack, in which 15 people were killed.   Today, the chief political correspondent at The Conversation, Michelle Grattan on whether Anthony Albanese can rise to the challenge.   Featured:    Michelle Grattan, chief political correspondent at The Conversation and a professorial fellow at the University of Canberra

title: Thousands have left Australia's Pacific worker scheme and are stuck in visa limbo | ABC NEWS
description: Workers leaving the Pacific Australia Labour Mobility scheme are seeking refuge in the nation’s fruit picking hubs. But experts warn they remain "extremely vulnerable". Lucy Cooper reports. title: Alleged Bondi killer Naveed Akram charged with 59 offences | ABC NEWS
description: Naveed Akram has been formally charged with 59 offences over the Bondi Beach attack which claimed 15 lives. The offences include 15 counts of murder. Akram remains in hospital under police guard. A second gunman, Akram’s father Sajid, was shot dead by police at the scene. title: The NFL’s grandad quarterback
description: There are comeback stories and then there is Philip Rivers. Five years after retiring from the NFL, the 44-year-old grandfather strapped on the cleats to try and drag his old team into the playoffs. His reasoning for taking on the challenge was something from cult TV show 'Friday Night Lights'. Featured: Phil Murphy, NFL reporter, ESPN.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Oil prices sink to four-year low, ASX slips | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Oil prices have fallen to their lowest level since February 2021 amid concerns about oversupply and a potential Russia-Ukraine peace deal. The Australian share market has fallen for its third straight day, following a mostly negative session on Wall Street. description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has revealed an increase in spending in the Mid-Year Economic and Fiscal Outlook. The opposition claims the decision could put upward pressure on inflation. title: Bondi victim funerals begin, as more stories of heroism are revealed | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 The first funerals commemorating the victims of the Bondi terror attack have been held in Sydney, with Rabbi Eli Schlanger remembered as "one of the purest and most sincere people" the Jewish community has known. 03:06 The memorials took place as the gunman, Naveed Akram was charged with 59 offences over the mass shooting. The offences include 15 counts of murder, committing a terrorist act and 40 counts of causing wounding/grievous bodily harm to person with intent to murder. 03:33 With Sydneysiders returning to Bondi to remember those killed in the attack, NSW Premier Chris Minns has announced he will recall state parliament to pass a suite of changes to the state's laws, including an individual limit on firearms, and a restriction on protests. 06:19 A furious and grieving former Federal Treasurer, Josh Frydenberg, has vented his anger at Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and the rise in antisemitism in an emotional speech at Bondi. 08:38 Officials in the Philippines are investigating whether the father and son gunmen had military-style training in the country in the lead-up to the Bondi Beach shootings. ABC Correspondent Tim Swanston reports from Davao. 10:09 More tales of selfless bravery are emerging about people who put themselves in harm's way to save others. title: CSIRO to receive $233m funding boost, agency job cuts to proceed | ABC NEWS
description: The CSIRO has received $233 million in federal funding in the mid-year budget update. But despite the injection, the agency intends to proceed with up to 350 job cuts announced in November to address rising costs. The union says although the one-off funding boost would help with urgent pressures at the CSIRO, tackling long-term challenges requires sustained investment. title: Why the Philippines is a hotbed for Islamic militants | The World | ABC NEWS
description: A senior counterterrorism official has told the ABC Naveed and Sajid Akram underwent military-style training in the southern Philippines last month. Mindanao, the southern island of the Philippines, has been a hotbed for Islamist militants since the 1990s. Greg Barton, Professor of Global Islamic Politics at Deakin University tells The World's Girish Sawlani Filipino authorities "are still struggling to deal with jihadi extremist groups".   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: What next for Hong Kong after Jimmy Lai conviction | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Media mogul Jimmy Lai, who is considered one of Hong Kong's strongest critics of China, has been found guilty of sedition and collusion as part of a landmark case led by Beijing. The verdict has drawn outcry from pro-democracy advocates around the world, and US President Donald Trump has asked Chinese leader Xi Jinping to overturn the conviction. Chung Ching Kwong, senior analyst at the Inter-Parliamentary Alliance on China, tells The World's Girish Sawlani it's unlikely China would consider releasing Jimmy Lai. title: Tom Silvagni, son of AFL star, sentenced to more than six years' jail | ABC News
description: Callous and deceptive. That's how a County Court judge has described the actions of Tom Silvagni in sentencing him to over six years in prison for raping a woman in his family's Melbourne home.  The 23-year-old is the son of AFL legend Stephen and TV personality Jo who had hired top lawyers to keep their son's name out of the spotlight during the trial.  Alexandra Alvaro reports.
